result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl D Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property <$300. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at the rate of $50 per month commencing 03-01-2017 and the 1st of each month thereafter or serve 4 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl D Dixon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kelsey Loshaw in court.   
Defendant Darryl D Dixon did not appear.  
Jury Trial Cancelled.

State moves to amend count 2 to a county ordinance of CDTP 13.102(c)(4)
Defense has no objection.

Atty. Loshaw enters a plea of No Contest to the amended count 2 on behalf of her client.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
DV Surcharge:  $100
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 03/01/17 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  4 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
